meanings.sent1: Her uninterests in the topic made the class discussion challenging.
meanings.sent2: The uninterests of the students were evident during the lecture.
meanings.sent3: His uninterests in the movie led to him falling asleep in the theater.
meanings.sent4: The uninterests of the audience were like a heavy fog over the performance.
meanings.sent5: The uninterests in the room were palpable, making it hard to engage the attendees.

meanings.definition: To cause someone to have no interest or concern.
meanings.sent1: The dry presentation uninterests the audience quickly.
meanings.sent2: Constant interruptions can uninterest even the most attentive listeners.
meanings.sent3: The repetitive nature of the task uninterests him to the point of frustration.
meanings.sent4: The monotonous tone of the speaker uninterests the entire room.
meanings.sent5: The lack of enthusiasm in his voice uninterests the listeners, causing them to lose focus.
